result.execSummary:
The defendant April M Richardson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.
DE will comply with all programming deemed appropriate per DOC agent.
DE will provide DNA sample and pay surcharge

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. April M Richardson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DE has indicated undecided about seeking PCR (filed in 15CF184)

Defendant April M Richardson in court with attorney Erika Caroline Bahnson.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM156.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  

15CF184-Ct 2-DE will enter a plea of NC.  Ct's 1,3 will be DRI. 

15CM156-DE will enter a plea of NC, court will accept both and find the DE guilty.  

Court will accept the recommendations of the parties, will order sentence withheld, 2 years probation, CC, DNA sample, surcharge, uncharged count will be DRI, will comply with all programming recommended by DOC agent.

Defendant April M Richardson in court with attorney Erika Caroline Bahnson.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM156.  State calls Lt Kevin Julien, oath given.  Direct by the State.  Cross by Atty Bahnson.  Witness dismissed.  Atty would like to call witness William Richardson, oath given.  Direct by Atty Bahnson.  Cross by the State.  State enters exhibit number one.  Exhibit received.  Redirect by Atty Bahnson.  Witness dismissed.  Argument by parties.  State asks for bind over.  Court will find probable cause exists, will bind over for JT.  Information filed this day by the court, will proceed to arraignment.  Waive reading of information, enter  a plea of NG. Set for RH 2-23-16 @ 1:00PM.
